channel.title: Sony on PSN: Credit card information may have been compromised
channel.description:
http://blog.eu.playstation.com/2011/04/26/psnqriocity-service-update/ http://faq.en.playstation.com/cgi-bin/scee_gb.cfg/php/enduser/std_adp.php?locale=en_GB&p_faqid=5593
If you have provided your credit card data through PlayStation Network or Qriocity, it is possible that your credit card number (excluding security code) and expiration date may also have been obtained.

item.title: Sony on PSN: Credit card information may have been compromised
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:39, topic:392776”]hacked again, way to go

now they need a welcome welcome back pack[/quote]

http://www.blackbergsecurity.us/

and if it isn’t up: http://i.imgur.com/Vf7PK.png

http://hassonybeenhackedthisweek.com/

LOOOOL

Read full topic

item.description:
@NiallInSweden wrote:

Frell:

hacked again, way to go

…and nintendo, so itäs not just limited to sony

BBC News

Nintendo server hit by hackers

Game maker Nintendo has become the latest victim of the shadowy hacker group known as Lulz Security.

item.title: Sony on PSN: Credit card information may have been compromised
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:34, topic:392776”]Uh, take cash if you’re gonna get fucked guys, really learn2play.

It also stops you spending all of you money on flashing/glittery things you saw in a store while peaking[/quote]
the problem with taking cash is ill end up finding a way to spend every last cent. (who does not need 20 snickers for a snack after a good night drinking), I seem to be more aware of what I’m purchasing when using a debit card.

/INB4 it does not matter with the Moparscape income.

Read full topic

item.title: Sony on PSN: Credit card information may have been compromised
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

goatee:

Luckily I tend to lose my card every month due to getting absolutely fucked in town, it’s inconvenient but it also means that even if my card details are stored somewhere, they will be useless within a month.

hahhh my bank charges me $5 usd for card replacements now for this very reason.

Read full topic
item.source: Sony on PSN: Credit card information may have been compromised

item.title: Sony on PSN: Credit card information may have been compromised
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:30, topic:392776”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=489946.msg3587997#msg3587997 date=1304351438]
I have a friend like you Goatee
[/quote]

I’m also the proud owner of the “First person in the family to lose their shoes on a night out” title. I had bought those shoes the very same day so owned them for less than a day :(, 50 quid down the drain. I know how to party… and blackout.[/quote]

Rofl, tragic! Losing your shoes man, haha.

[quote=“tL, post:29, topic:392776”]Oh I’m not going to defend them at all. It is their responsibility to keep your data safe and they failed.

I’m addressing his specific post which assumes it is possible to make something completely secure.[/quote]

Ah kk. Funny thing is, after all this I bet they’ve already made their network 100% more secure than it was!

Read full topic

No network is 100% secure.

I have a friend like you Goatee

Luckily I tend to lose my card every month due to getting absolutely fucked in town, it’s inconvenient but it also means that even if my card details are stored somewhere, they will be useless within a month. And in the meantime, Barclays can stay pissed off at my regular, hungover phone calls.

item.dc:creator: @Reaper114 Reaper114
item.description:
@Reaper114 wrote:

Thanks Playstation, just goes to show how far technology has gotten us this far yet they can’t protect their own shit…

And what happened to this thing called security… for a large corporation… I highly doubt they even tried to keep their shit together at all.

The millions of dollars they get from people… ya think they could have made their protection a little better than that.

Read full topic
